Database Manager¶

class biodb_team_3.db_manager.Manager(connection=None)[source]¶

Class that hanldes the database. Has functions for populating the database as well as querying it.

create_protein(uniprot_name, uniprot_accession)[source]¶

If it doesn’t exist, creates a protein object and returns

Parameters:
  • uniprot_name (str) – Uniprot name
  • uniprot_accession (str) – Uniprot accession number
create_tables()[source]¶

Create the empty database (tables)

drop_tables()[source]¶

Drop all the tables in the database.

find_protein(uniprot_accession)[source]¶

Returns a protein name based on its accession

Parameters:uniprot_accesion (str) – Uniprot accession number
Rtype str:Protein name
get_associated_disease_with_omim_id(omim_id)[source]¶

Query associated(share associated proteins) diseases with given omim identifier

:param str omim_id：OMIM identifier

get_omim_id_with_uniprot_id(accessions)[source]¶

Query the database with an uniprot accession and retrieve omim ids

Parameters:accession (list) – Uniprot accession
get_shared_associated_proteins_by_omim_ids(omim_ids)[source]¶

Query shared associated proteins’ id by a list of omim ids

Parameters:omim_ids (list) – OMIM identifiers
get_uniprot_id_with_omim_id(accessions)[source]¶

Query the database with an omim identifier to then retrieve uniprot accessions.

Parameters:accession (list) – OMIM identifier
pickleIt(obj)[source]¶

This function dumps the given object as a pickled file to the current working directory and informs the user

populate_db(data=None)[source]¶

Populates database with disease - protein association data

Parameters:of list data (list) – Disease - protein association data, each single list begins with an OMIM id, followed by associated proteins’ uniprot name and accession number
query_for_disease_single(uniprot_id, pckl=False)[source]¶

Takes an uniprot ID as input and returns OMIM IDs of the associated diseases. It can also return/save the pickled list for downstream pipelines

Parameters:uniprot_id (string) – Uniprot protein ID
Return type:list
query_for_protein_single(omim_id, pckl=False)[source]¶

This function will take an omim ID and return a list of associated protein. It can also return/save the pickled list for downstream pipelines

Parameters:omim_id (string) – OMIM disease ID
Return type:list
